column4: I performed an update on my Ubuntu installation and for what ever reason the post configuration did not complete.  The computer was shut down (not by me) before I could see the errors.  This would normally not be an issue but for some reason the initrd.img was deleted and a new one was not installed so now the system will not boot.
I tried running from the live distro and finishing the post configuration (chroot, dpkg --configure -a) but I get a /dev/null resitriction since I'm running off the live distro.
any suggestions?
how dose your menu.lst look?
it has the link to the kernel and the initrd (which is no longer there).
the kernel is there but I can't access the root file system with out the initrd.
thats what I'm looking for.
What kernel is it now? 2.6.8?
if I can remount dev to the internal HD then I will be in good shape.
yes, its 2.6.8
I tried booting with out the initrd but it cant access the root fs.
do you have root            (hd0,0) in menu list?
menu.lst
my Linux root is grub:(hd0,2), Kernel:(hda3)
Why did you ask the root question?
cause you said it couldnt find root.

it just cant mount the root since the kernel module for the FS is not loaded and is on the root file system so it can't be loaded.  Thats why the initrd is important to beat the chicken before the egg issue ;)
gotcha.
there was something in the gentoo stuff that allowed oyu to chroot from the live cd to the mounted root partition...let me see if I can find that...then maybe you can use dpkg or apt
Thanks that would be a big help.  I have been able to chroot but I get the /dev/null errors since it is tied to the live distro.
http://www.gentoo.org/doc/en/handbook/2004.2/handbook-x86.xml?full=1
not 100% sure if it will help you considering the env-update.
